text: I've always been looking for studying abroad and what brought me to that decision was my mother who actually studied a lot of foreign languages owing to her love for traveling all around the world. Thereby I followed her steps so as to learn even more from the world surrounding me, I would say I'm quite curious in life. Nevertheless, it requires to be dedicated in that task in order to make that dream possible. Therefore, during the past holidays, I went to Paris for about a week and a half, accompanied by my father since he had to be there for one of his coworker's marriage. We landed next to Paris by aircraft, despite my ears hurting so much due to the air pressure, I automatically felt in love for that country, for people's kindness (which kinda change from French's behavior and the fact that they are quite narrow minded whereas Swedish ), breathtaking  landscapes, that colorful main city etc... even if the gastronomy ain't that good though. By the way I can't way to discover more of this country no matter what, and why not go to the northern part for my next internship , as a software developer, which will take place at the end of the year. I already tried to extend my network, meaning I got contacts, for future researches unless opportunities come to me by their own. As a student, life's expensive, even more in Paris where prices are pretty high for no apparent reason, thus I'm here now to ask for any scholarship that can avoid me plenty issues there. It would help me to finance my monthly youth hostel bill, tickets cost for the flights. In fact, I won't be able to afford it all since I'll probably not going to be paid, or not that much actually. I would rather do my life in Paris but any scandinave country would be great aswell, I plan to live there in the future because Paris is well known for its advanced technology field, and grow as a developer, get better and even better in my developing skills and general knowledge.
